response.answer_text: “Someone To Stay” is an ethereal song by Vancouver Sleep Clinic. It talks about loving and the desire to have that love reciprocated. I love how the song is so vulnerable, it shows how open a person can be when loving — an exposure of the soul — it made the words Can you keep me close? Can you love me most? set a mood of yearning and a taste of love’s paradox. Vancouver Sleep Clinic The stage name of the indie act, ambient singer, songwriter and record producer Tim Bettinson, told The Guardian, “when I first starting [sic] writing for this project, I felt like it could be the type of atmospheric music that people could fall asleep to…”.  Hailing from Brisbane, Australia, Bettinson grew up jamming on his dad's Eagles and Fleetwood Mac records but he got his lightning bolt when he heard of Bon Iver's For Emma, Forever Ago and Sigur Ros' Valtari — from that moment, he knew he wanted to make music and not just listen to it.
